content: drips a quick and easy colorwork hat drips is a spunky slightly slouchy colorwork hat made to mimic the appearance of paint drips running down the beanie it is meant to be knit and worn playfully this is an excellent first color- work project if you have yet to take the leap into the world of knitting with more than one color switch up the colors or yarn make it your own have fun materials 1 skein blue sky alpacas worsted organic cotton color 635 - gray mc 1 skein blue sky alpacas worsted organic cotton color 607 - lime cc or 100 yards each worsted-aran weight yarn to achieve gauge see below needles size 8 16-inch circular needles plus a set of size 8 double-pointed needles or 40-inch circular size 8 needle if using the magic loop method gauge 4 stitches per inch stockinette in the round begin hat using mc and long-tail method cast on 76 sts join in the round and work in k1 p1 rib for 1 5 inches increase round beginning in stockinette knit all stitches increase 12 sts in the next row using the m1 make one method - roughly every 6 sts or so - 88 sts in all at the end of this round knit plain stockinette until hat measures 3 1/2 inches from cast-on edge begin chart note when working through the colorwork chart be mindful of your gauge especially through the first few row to avoid any bunching of the fabric the chart is read from right to left bottom to top work row 1-11 of the colorwork chart see below next row cut mc leaving a 6 inch tail now continue knitting in plain stockinette with cc for 1 5 inches decrease sequence you will now begin decreasing for the crown if you are using the 16-inch circulars switch to double- pointed needles when needed row 1 k6 k2tog - repeat throughout round row 2 knit all sts row 3 k5 k2tog - repeat throughout round row 4 knit all sts row 5 k4 k2tog - repeat throughout round row 6 knit all sts row 7 k3 k2tog - repeat throughout round row 8 knit all sts row 9 k2 k2tog - repeat throughout round row 10 knit all sts row 11 k1 k2tog - repeat throughout round last decrease row 12 k2tog - repeat through- out round - 11 sts remain cut yarn thread through remaining stitches and cinch closed weave in any loose ends block if desired or if the gauge on the colorwork area could use some evening out add a large fluffy pom pom if desired recommended wear and enjoy =cc © bethany hill 2012 www prettylittlefiberco com = mc
